BOOK NOW Flûte Bar Floating Bubbles BOOK NOW About Gallery Menus Restaurant Policies The world’s highest open-air champagne Bienvenue à Flute. The highest open-air champagne in the world, perched on a platform above Bangkok icons Sirocco and Sky. It’s the perfect vantage point to take in the magic and merriment of the whole sky-high scene, and experience some magic of your own. About Flute After a couple flutes of fine champagne, you might begin to feel like your platform in the sky is actually a stage, and perhaps you’re the star of the show. That’s how champagne this exquisite—this rare—can make you feel. Special. Elevated. Like somewhere along the way you must have done something very right, to end up here. With a living wall designed to evoke a vineyard—a vineyard in the sky, that is—Flute is a place to sip slowly and take it all in. These precious liquids are meant to be savoured—experienced fully. After all, some of these experiences will never be repeated. These exclusive bottles of bubbly feel like they should be in a museum—but instead, a fortunate few get to touch them. Consume them. Lucky you! Flute is the only place you’ll find them in Thailand. Also exclusive to The Dome: Exclusive House of Caviar including Caviar Service, Imperial Beluga, Beluga, Royal Oscietra and Oscietra, and premium oysters . With Flute, we invite you to live like a bon vivant, if only for the night. Gallery Our Menus Champagne Restaurant Policies DRESS CODE To ensure a pleasant and elegant atmosphere for all guests, we kindly ask everyone to adhere to our dress code. Smart casual dress code for restaurants and bars For Women: Elegant tops, blouses, dresses, skirts, tailored shorts, and dress sandals are appropriate. For Men: Collared shirts (polo or button-down), t-shirts, tailored shorts, loafers, or elegant sandals are welcome. Not permitted: Athletic wear, swimwear, sleeveless shirts (for men), flip-flops, and beach slippers. Smart elegant attire for Chef’s Table, Mezzaluna and Pink Bar For Women: Elegant tops, blouses, dresses, skirts, tailored shorts, and dress sandals are appropriate. For Men: Collared shirts and long trousers are required. T-shirts, sleeveless clothing, shorts, and caps are not permitted. Long jeans are acceptable when paired with covered shoes. Dress codes and policies apply to all guests, including children. CHILD POLICY Children of all ages are welcome at Sirocco and Breeze . At Mezzaluna, Chef’s Table, Sky Bar, and The Flute Bar , children aged 7 and above are welcome when accompanied by an adult. Distil Bar, Alfresco 64, lebua No.3, and Pink Bar are for adults only (20+). PHOTOGRAPHY We encourage you to capture memorable moments during your visit. Photography is allowed in most areas of our establishments, except where signage indicates otherwise. Please note that tripods, extension poles, and external flash units are not permitted. LUGGAGE To ensure a comfortable and seamless experience for all guests, we kindly ask that backpacks, shopping bags, suitcases, and other large luggage items not be brought into our venues. Please be advised that luggage storage is not available at this time. CANCELLATION & AMENDMENT POLICY A deposit is required to guarantee your reservation and will be deducted from your final bill at the restaurant. Please note that your booking is not confirmed until the deposit has been received. Reservations may be amended or canceled up to 72 hours prior to the reservation time without any charge. Cancellations, no-shows, or changes made less than 72 hours in advance will result in the deposit being retained as a cancellation fee without prior notice. For special event dates (such as New Year’s Eve, Christmas Eve, and Valentine’s Day) and group reservations , a 100% non-refundable deposit is required in advance. This deposit is non-refundable, non-transferable, and cannot be applied to other reservations, events, or functions in case of cancellation or no-show.                                                                (1) View on map By Lateef Okunnu . Opens Closed Location: 20, Broadwick Street, W1F 8HT Budget: Type of night: Chatting and Drinking Type of venue: Wine Bar What they say: FlÃ»te was created by founder and owner Hervé Rousseau, in 1997. A native Parisian, Hervé was inspired by his experience in the wine industry to combine New Yorks unparalleled cocktail culture with a French attitude towards champagne, where no one waits for a special occasion to pop open a bottle of bubbly. With 15 years experience in working with champagne houses, Hervé is one of America's top ambassadors of French Champagne. Now branching out to London, FlÃ»te is due to open in December 2011 and will be an ideal place to take a date you're wishing to impress. What we say: Due to its strong international following and excellent reputation we're really excited for the opening of Flûte in London. With its great central location (just seconds away from Oxford Circus ) and its exquisite interior Flûte is going to be one of the most popular cocktail bars in London . The capital is certainly lacking in high-end, luxurious Champagne Bars but we're certain Flûte's opening will put a stop to that and turn in to a regular haunt amongst celebrities .
